#Exploring The genres
```{r}
# Explore the distribution of genres
genre_counts <- table(unlist(strsplit(df$genres, "', '")))
barplot(genre_counts, main = "Genre Distribution", xlab = "Genres", las=2)  # las=2 for horizontal label orientation

# Explore the distribution of artists
artist_counts <- table(df$artist_name)
barplot(head(sort(artist_counts, decreasing = TRUE), 20), main = "Top 20 Artists", xlab = "Artist", las=2)
# Histogram of track popularity
ggplot(df, aes(x = popularity)) + 
  geom_histogram(bins = 20, fill = "steelblue", color = "black") +
  labs(title = "Distribution of Track Popularity", x = "Popularity", y = "Count")

# Scatter plot of energy vs. danceability
ggplot(df, aes(x = energy, y = danceability)) +
  geom_point(alpha = 0.5) +
  labs(title = "Energy vs. Danceability", x = "Energy", y = "Danceability")
```
```{r}
# Load required libraries
library(readr)
library(dplyr)
library(tidyr)
library(ggplot2)

# Read the dataset
df <- read.csv("top_50_2023.csv", sep=",", header=TRUE)

# Check the structure of the dataset
str(df)

# Summary statistics
summary(df)


# Check for missing values
sum(is.na(df))

# 1. Genre Popularity
# Split genres column into separate rows
genres_df <- df %>%
  separate_rows(genres, sep = ",") %>%
  mutate(genres = trimws(genres))  # Remove leading and trailing whitespaces

# Plot genre frequency
genre_freq <- genres_df %>%
  count(genres) %>%
  arrange(desc(n)) %>%
  top_n(10)

ggplot(genre_freq, aes(x = reorder(genres, n), y = n)) +
  geom_bar(stat = "identity", fill = "skyblue") +
  labs(x = "Genre", y = "Frequency", title = "Top 10 Genres in 2023")

# 2. Mood and Music
# Correlation between valence, energy, and danceability
correlation <- df %>%
  select(valence, energy, danceability) %>%
  cor()

correlation

# 3. Trends Analysis
# Track duration trend
ggplot(df, aes(x = as.Date(album_release_date), y = duration_ms)) +
  geom_point() +
  geom_smooth(method = "lm", se = FALSE) +
  labs(x = "Release Date", y = "Track Duration (ms)", title = "Track Duration Trend Over 2023")

# Popularity trend
ggplot(df, aes(x = as.Date(album_release_date), y = popularity)) +
  geom_point() +
  geom_smooth(method = "lm", se = FALSE) +
  labs(x = "Release Date", y = "Popularity", title = "Popularity Trend Over 2023")

```
